definition: Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4

sentences.english: With him as my key I was able to unlock another world, a happier land.
sentences.chinese: 他是我打开另一个极乐世界的钥匙。

sentences.english: E.g. Amitabha Buddha (Amituofo) has infinite life for helping countless beings in Pure Land.
sentences.chinese: 无量佛陀在极乐世界无穷尽的生命普度众生。

sentences.english: The judges say I have to go now to Elysium and that it will be nice there. I miss my family.
sentences.chinese: 法官们说我现在可以去极乐世界，那里会很美好。

sentences.english: They put on their headphones, drape a hood over their head and drift off into the world of "digital highs".
sentences.chinese: 他们戴上耳机，裹住头部，沉溺于“数码极乐世界”。

sentences.english: A small niche in the rear houses Amitabha of Sukhavati (Land of Ultimate Bliss).
sentences.chinese: 后面小洞内供西方极乐世界阿弥陀佛。

sentences.english: The inscription of 'Extreme Happiness' behind the hill is in the handwriting of Emperor QianLong.
sentences.chinese: 在山后挂着“极乐世界”字样御笔亲书的金匾。

sentences.english: Is Elysium there are joy and sadness?
sentences.chinese: 极乐世界是有快乐和悲伤的吗？

sentences.english: Those fairy forms of bliss Elysian.
sentences.chinese: 那些极乐世界的仙女们。

sentences.english: I don't think that human's ultimate goal is to be immortal and live in the Elysian Fields.
sentences.chinese: 我不认为人类的终极目标就是在极乐世界中永生。

sentences.english: Or should I not think about anything while chanting Amitabha Buddha?
sentences.chinese: 念阿弥陀佛，回向自己往生西方极乐世界。

definition: Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)

definition: to be reborn/to live in paradise (Buddhism)/to die/(after) one's death
to become a Buddha/to attain enlightenment
boundless life (expression of good wishes)/Amitayus, the Buddha of measureless life, good fortune and wisdom
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
